page.title: 16Benfleet - The housing
page.content: The housing in the area is mixed. There are old cottages, some post war bungalows and a few recent (1970's) town houses.The most extensive development (1950's-1960's) has spread from the centre towards the N.W. and N.E. The lack of building space around old Benfleet has preserved the character of the village. No further housing development of The Downs is allowed at the present time as the area is designated an open space for the pleasure and recreation of local people. The Downs are managed by Castle Point District Council, who seeks to preserve its natural beauty and wildlife habitats. The land from Benfleet Station,2 Kilometres eastwards, is mainly shrubs, grassland and old meadows, leading eventually to wood land.
